Name: Natural High Forest Rehabilitation Project on degraded land of Kibale National Park
taxa_notes: only mammals and 1 reptile noted as resulting from the animal censuses; MR mentions that they plan to start monitoring butterflies
methods_notes: animal censuses are conducted every 5 years; "transects" (MR: p 38)

Name: TIST Program in Kenya, VCS 005
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
taxa_notes: no animals monitored; only vegetation
methods_notes: number of veg plots based on downloaded excel file (see data_notes)
data_notes: full vegetation data available here: http://www.tist.org/PD-KE-VCS-005%20Documents.php

Name: Carbon Project in the Emas-Taquari Biodiversity Corridor, Goiás and Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil
taxa_notes: 222 species of birds noted, but a lesser number were named
methods_notes: "MacKinnon quantitative method" was used to quantify birds; jaguars were trapped and GPS tracked; apparently 26 camera trapping stations
data_notes: " annex O and O.1 of the first MIR (Annex B)" is reported to contain more wildlife data, but not available

Name: ‘Guanaré’ Forest Plantations on degraded grasslands under extensive grazing
taxa_notes: native plant and amphibian monitoring also mentioned, but no species names provided
methods_notes: traps for mammals, "walking tours" and auditory surveys for birds and other fauna

Name: RMDLT Portel - Para REDD Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
methods_notes: wildlife monitoring via "information of sightings and recording evidence of species habitation"; vegetation monitored via same plots as carbon measurements (no sample size given)

Name: TIST Program in India, VCS 001
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
taxa_notes: formal monitoring of tree species; birds and bees mentioned, but not monitored
data_notes: raw vegetation monitoring data available: http://www.tist.org/PD-IN-VCS-001%20Documents.php

Name: JARI/AMAPÁ REDD+ PROJECT
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: formal bird, mammal (large/med) & plant monitoring; scarab beetles were planned, but dropped
methods_notes: 6 bird transects surveyed; 6 camera traps plus visual observations & sign; 158 veg plots of 100 x 100m
data_notes: the plan mentions an Appendix of indicator species that was not available

Name: Mjumita Community Forest Project (Lindi)
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
taxa_notes: formal monitoring for a threatened primate (Galagoides rondoensis ) and targeted monitoring of a few listed plants
methods_notes: nocturnal transect surveys for the primate with audio recorder; targeted searches and marking of threatened plants
data_notes: data stored at 3 locations by the organization MJUMITA

Name: Laguna Seca Forest Carbon Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: formal camera trap and incidental observation monitoring for "large/medium" mammals and birds
methods_notes: systematic camera trappings (extensive survey with over 50 locations w 2 cameras each) plus opportunistic surveys; "bird surveys" mentioned but no methods provided
data_notes: some raw data available in the report; statement that data is kept on DVD in Belize & US (not public)

Name: Bale Mountains Eco-region REDD+ project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold; Gold
taxa_notes: no formal animal monitoring except community member interviews about wildlife prevalence; MR provides info on regional mammals and birds but no specific sightings from the project area
methods_notes: no formal biodiversity monitoring: "...it is very difficult to quantify biodiversity as this was not measured as part of project monitoring." There is some "Community Based Monitoring (CBM)" or local perception of amount of "wild animal" sightings and killings in nearby forests (assuming mammals based on T&E species of interest), but no taxa explicity reported; otherwise, just remote sensing

Name: Forest Management to reduce deforestation and degradation in Shipibo Conibo and Cacataibo Indigenous communities of Ucayali region
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: fauna and tree monitoring
methods_notes: difficult to locate methods for the extensive fauna sightings reported in 5.3.1; tree census plots; fauna apparently from a sightings database and "fauna monitoring sheets" filled out by community
data_notes: kml file didn't work

Name: The Envira Amazonia Project - A Tropical Forest Conservation Project in Acre, Brazil
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
taxa_notes: formal bird and (targeted) plant monitoring; many bird species listed as documented en route, but only 8 species documented on site in 2015
methods_notes: bird survey used strip transects and followed FAO protocol (number of transects unreported); veg surveys involved documenting individual plants with GPS
data_notes: bird lists from initial inventory posted in full in report (and available via eBird)

Name: Acapa -_ Bajo Mira Y Frontera REDD+ Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: no 'in field' biodiversity monitoring during the reporting period (2013-2018)
methods_notes: "in-field and community-based monitoring did not take place during this monitoring period"; only remote sensing
data_notes: remotely-sensed imagery available to auditors

Name: Carmen del Darién (CDD) REDD+ Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: no 'in field' biodiversity monitoring during the reporting period
methods_notes: "in-field and community-based monitoring did not take place during this monitoring period"; local (transects) and community-based monitoring planned in future

Name: SIVIRÚ-USARAGÁ-PIZARRO-PILIZÁ (SUPP) REDD+ Project

taxa_notes: no 'in field' biodiversity monitoring during the reporting period

Name: Cajambre REDD+ Project

taxa_notes: no 'in field' biodiversity monitoring during the reporting period

Name: Concosta REDD+ Project

taxa_notes: no 'in field' biodiversity monitoring during the reporting period

Name: RESEX Rio Preto-Jacundá REDD+ Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: frugivorous butterflies' monitored using traps (identified to "tribe" level, 10 tribes total), but species not listed; mammal and bird species numbers are max from table

Name: Grouped Project for Commercial Forest Plantations Initiatives in the Department of Vichada
taxa_notes: 37 mammals (bats, med/large species) noted; birds monitored with mist nets and point counts but no species listed

Name: Lacandon – Forest for life REDD+ Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
methods_notes: camera traps were spread across 5 sites

Name: REDD+ Project Resguardo Indigena Unificado Selva de Mataven (RIU SM)
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
taxa_notes: many more taxa identified as present in the region, but only select T&E or endemic species actually listed as being monitored; only the common plant taxa were listed; tree species recorded in surveys along 10 transect lines

Name: REDD+ Project for Caribbean Guatemala: The Conservation Coast
Proponent: Fundacion para el Ecodesarrollo y la Conservacion [FUNDAECO]
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
methods_notes: bird and mammal methods unspecified
data_notes: a "Bird monitoring report 2019" and "Amphibians Monitoring report 2019" are referenced but not available

Name: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation in Keo Seima Wildlife Sanctuary
Proponent: Royal Government of Cambodia (RGC), Ministry of Environment

Name: Carbono Nascentes do Xingu
taxa_notes: 26 'animal species' are noted as being listed in 'Annex 6'

notes: estimated project location based on matching up satelite map features

Name: Fazenda Sao Paulo Afforestation
methods_notes: mammals, birds, and reptiles noted by army ant control personele during regular patrols; camera trap survey planned

Name: Tumring REDD+ Project
Proponent: The Royal Government of Cambodia, Forestry Administration

methods_notes: transect surveys, opportunistic surveys (birds/mammals), forest vegetation plots

Name: Scheme of Compensation for Ecosystem Services for Forest Management and Conservation of Water Sources in the Jurisdiction of CORPOCHIVOR

taxa_notes: 2 reptiles mentioned in human-wlidlife conflict section but not tracked with surveys

Name: Southern Cardamom REDD+ Project
Proponent: Royal Government of Cambodia (RGC), Ministry of Environment

methods_notes: ranger patrols, camera traps (6), elephant DNA mark-recapture, vegetation survey plots mentioned but no species listed

Name: Grouped Project for restoration of degraded lands in Jaguar Corridors, Colombia
taxa_notes: 4 of the mammals are listed as targets of monitoring but were not actually listed as being observed

Name: Jari/Pará REDD+ Project

Name: Qinghai Afforestation Project

Name: Haidong Afforestation Project
Proponent: Qinghai Forestry Ecological Construction and Investment Co., Ltd.

Name: Qianxinan Afforestation Project in Guizhou Province
methods_notes: MR states "All the fresh animal feces met should be sampled for molecular biological analysis." though no results related to this were reported. No mammals were encountered in surveys apparently.

Name: Hechu Afforestation Project in Anhui Province
Proponent: Hefei Zhuoya Landscaping Engineering Co., Ltd.
methods_notes: MR states "All the fresh animal feces met should be sampled for molecular biological analysis." though no results related to this were reported.

methods_notes: MR states "All the fresh animal feces met should be sampled for molecular biological analysis." though no results related to this were reported.

methods_notes: MR states "All the fresh animal feces met should be sampled for molecular biological analysis." though no results related to this were reported.

Name: Jilin Linjiang Afforestation Project

Name: Hunan Northern and Northwestern Area Afforestation Project

Name: Ntakata Mountains REDD
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation

Name: Makame Savannah REDD
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold

Name: Hubei Hongshan IFM (Conversion of Logged to Protected Forest) Project

Name: Floresta Verde REDD+ Project
Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation
methods_notes: veg plots were same as those used for carbon measurements; mammal and bird observations were performed during patrols

Name: Carbono Verde AR Project
taxa_notes: ranger kept track of mammals, birds and reptiles, but table 17 only showed select mammals encountered; only one bird species listed and no reptiles species listed
methods_notes: monitoring was opportunistic sightings of bird, mammals, and reptiles by ranger during leaf-cutter ant patrols

Name: Guinan Afforestation Project
methods_notes: "All fresh animal feces must be sampled every time for molecular biological analysis." But no results from this reported, so assuming no samples tested.

Name: Qianbei Afforestation Project

Name: Chudu Afforestation Project

taxa_notes: report states 7 individuals of 2 species of animals (wild hog and eagle)
methods_notes: "All the fresh animal feces met should be sampled for molecular biological analysis." but no results reported.

Name: Delta Blue Carbon – 1
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
taxa_notes: Monitoring results table 3.2.1 states "fish and shrimp species diversity" increased; also amphibians, birds, mammals; methods annex describes butterfly and odonate monitoring methods
methods_notes: marine organsims: net transects, baited traps (both every 50 m); bats: harp traps, acoustic monitoring
data_notes: A consultant-prepared biodiversity monitoring results report is referenced, but not available. "The whole monitoring process is fully documented in text, photographic and videographic form and is available for review by the VVB."

Name: BLUE CARBON PROJECT GULF OF MORROSQUILLO “VIDA MANGLAR”

taxa_notes: manatee, otter, and needle caiman were the focus

Name: Anhuang Afforestation Project
Proponent: Guizhou Xinzhanxin Agricultural Technology Co., Ltd.
methods_notes: "All fresh animal feces must be sampled every time for molecular biological analysis." But no results from this reported, so assuming no samples tested.

Name: TIST Program in Kenya, VCS-CCB 010
Distinctions: Climate Gold; Community Gold; Biodiversity Gold
taxa_notes: no animals monitored; only vegetation
methods_notes: veg_plots is the number of project areas in which trees were planted and censused; only tree species monitoring noted; qualified as Biodiversity Gold due to the presence of >4000 individuals of an endangered tree (Meru Oak)
data_notes: raw monitoring data available on TIST website, though not easy to access across multiple websites (one per project area)

Name: TIST Program in Uganda, VCS-CCB 010

methods_notes: veg_plots is the number of project areas in which trees were planted and censused; qualified as Biodiversity Gold due to the presence of >300 individuals of an endangered tree (Prunus africanus)

Name: Zhangye City Afforestation Project in Gansu Province
taxa_notes: bird surveys completed but no species listed (only lists the species that should be in the area)

Name: Miaoling Afforestation Project

Name: Huadu Afforestation Project

Name: Liugui Afforestation Project

Monitor the observed numbers of the birds occurred around the monitoring points during a whole day, 10 monitoring points have been set to monitor animal population associated with forest (birds)
which selected randomly.

Name: Baoxing Afforestation Project

Name: Mindanao Tree Planting Program for our Climate and Communities (MinTrees)

Name: Gansu Lanzhou Afforestation Project

Name: Shanxi Loufan Afforestation Project
taxa_notes: one pheasant species mentioned as benefitting, but not clear if seen on site; otherwise, bird species not named

Name: Generation Forest Group Project

methods_notes: 20 camera traps; formal avian monitoring by an affiliated non-profit (methods unspecified)

Name: TAHUAMANU AMAZON REDD PROJECT

Name: AFFORESTATION OF DEGRADED GRASSLANDS IN VICHADA, COLOMBIA
taxa_notes: plant species total is from gallery forest on site; restoration area total was 30 spp plants

Name: BRAZILIAN AMAZON APD GROUPED PROJECT

taxa_notes: bird and mammal species counts are highs from 2 surveys (rainy/dry season); counts of "reptile and amphibian" species lumped together; no complete species lists

Name: Yunnan Qiubei Afforestation Project

Name: Reforestation grouped project Norteak Nicaragua

Name: Gansu Zhangye Grouped Afforestation Project

Name: Yunnan Yulong Afforestation Project

Name: Yan’an Wuqi Afforestation Project

Name: Guiyang Afforestation Project

Name: JOil Jatropha plantation in Ghana

Name: Humbo Ethiopia Assisted Natural Regeneration Project
taxa_notes: trees planted were listed (some were non-native)
methods_notes: no  biodiversity monitoring; only training of local people on importance of biodiversity etc.

Name: Aprosacao Reforestation Project: community reforestation and agroforestry with small-scale cocoa farmers in Honduras.
taxa_notes: original sustainability monitoring plan mentions previous soil biota and mammal monitoring (with camera traps);  also mentions plans to continue soil biota monitoring but not mammal monitoring; no report of results in the verification or "key project info" reports and seems to have been dropped (a change in the sus. mon. plan is mentioned)
methods_notes: original sustainability monitoring plan mentions previous soil biota and mammal monitoring (with camera traps);  also mentions plans to continue soil biota monitoring and also mammal monitoring but not the camera trap monitoring (will come up with another way to monitor mammals); no report of monitoring results in the verification or "key project info" reports; not counting camera trapping as "monitoring" as it wasn't repeated
notes: just the planted area

Name: Vichada Climate Reforestation Project (PAZ)
methods_notes: biodiversity monitoring (from sustainability monitoring plan) apparently consists only of forest cover and IBAT tool to check which Red List species are in area
notes: area is just for the planted area; annual reductions was listed as 1 on website (likely error), so used 325,487 / 10 yr (2006-2015) from PDD

Name: WithOneSeed Timor Leste Community Forestry Program
methods_notes: SD 15 (life on land) monitored only with community participation & tree cover: "Increased community engagement in reforestation and increase in the number of trees under management annually"
notes: estimated project eligible (planting) area based on projections to 2039

Name: Afforestation with Hazelnut Plantations in Western Georgia
taxa_notes: taxa unspecified other than fungi: "Also surveys of native fauna and flora is carried out, attached a survey of local fungi present in the plantation"
methods_notes: sustainability monitoring plan mentions annual surveys for "flora & fauna" and also fungi list from the 11% retained as natural area, but methods not specified
notes: coordinates based on online map; area is planted "eligible area"

Name: Reforestation Sierra Piura
taxa_notes: none, except list of native plants found on site from a previous report; not included in monitoring report
methods_notes: sustainability monitoring plan indicates that SDG15 monitored via forest cover estimates only
notes: coordinates estimated based on PDF map; 213ha planted area (plantation)

Name: Afforestation on Degraded Lands in Mountainous Areas of Northern Guangdong China
methods_notes: apparently no on-the-ground monitoring of animal populations or diversity
notes: coordinates based on online map

Name: Kikonda Forest Reserve
taxa_notes: one native plant mentioned, the native pine species they are growing in the plantation
notes: no sustainability monitoring plan document available online; 4929 = eligible area; coords based on map on page 11 of PDD

Name: ArBolivia- Phase II
taxa_notes: list of threatened taxa known to occur nearby are included on a list of species monitored under a "biodiversity monitoring plan" that is unpublished. 12 Native tree species planted & discussed
methods_notes: "a biodiversity monitoring system is in place."
data_notes: "See attachment “004-06 and 04-07 ”on monitoring of biodiversity”."; "Biodiversity will be monitored regularly. See attachment “03-01 & 03-02 Monitoreo biodiversidad_03_Nova.pdf”."
notes: no sustainability monitoring plan document available online; 6000 ha is estimated eligible area in future; coordinates based on Fig III.2 in PDD

Name: CO2OL Tropical Mix
taxa_notes: none specified in PDD or SMP except "flora and fauna"
methods_notes: monitoring frequency is listed as "crediting period" which is 30 years; PDD speaks of "flora and fauna" (endemic & threatened species) monitoring by interviews and other community-based approaches; Sustainability Monitoring plan is less specific
data_notes: a biodiversity monitoring report with the following name was referenced in the SMP: TMIX19_FoFi_Biodiversity_Progress_report_2017_2018_Screen. Pages 21-25
notes: area = planting area (PDD, p.3); coordinates roughly based on map on project website

Name: BaumInvest Reforestation Project
taxa_notes: vertebrates plus aquatic insects recorded as baseline, followup herp survey done in 2019, plans to continue to monitor other taxa at unspecified intervals, from SMP: "Increment on the number of fauna species based on a continuous biodiversity monitoring and/or biodiversity indexes."
methods_notes: No methods specified for fauna surveys, but presumably these are available in the multiple unavailable reports cited; only rudimentary results provided (species counts, Shannon H values)
data_notes: From PDD re baseline surveys: "Further details, together with the complete list of species, can be found in the paper 'Evaluación Ecológica Rápida' and the Senckenberg Research Institute and Natural History Museum's research findings." Other unavailable reports cited.
notes: area  from pg. 1 of PDD; coordinates guestimated from coarse map

Name: Sustainable cocoa plantation system (agroforestry) in East Nicaragua
taxa_notes: only tree cover was monitored to track progress on SDG15 (life on land); and it was not even tracked in the first report due to the small size of the trees
methods_notes: Only tree cover was monitored
notes: area from pg. 9 on Key Project Info. Document; coordinates very approximate based on coarse map; emmissions/yr = 2100 (from verification report) / 4 years (2013-2016)

Name: EcoMakala Virunga Reforestation project
country_area: Congo the Democratic Republic of the
taxa_notes: No monitoring indicators for biodiversity in SMP
notes: area = Key Project Information (2018; eligible planted area); "around 10,000 ha have already been planted of which around 3,485 ha are eligible in accordance with the requirements of the Gold Standard"; annual emissions reduction based on annual credits listed on website

Name: Bagepalli CDM Reforestation Programme
methods_notes: sent questionaires to local residents asking if they saw many mammals, birds, bees, etc. (metric was % of 39 smallholder farmers saying 'yes')
notes: coordinates based on online map; there are also coordinates in the PDD that are similar; area = planted area according to 2021 Key Project Info document

Name: ACP Sustainable Forest Cover Establishment Project
taxa_notes: list of 28 native tree species to be planted; no other taxa referenced
methods_notes: no animal monitoring
notes: 2341 ha (elligible planting area) + 345 ha (nature conservation area) from PDD; coords are very approx. from map

Name: Afforestation on the Big Island of Hawaii: Restoring native hardwood forests and enhancing multiple ecosystem services
taxa_notes: many individuals of one native tree species (koa) planted; (no SMP found, but enough info in PDD & annual report)
notes: coordinates from lat/lon on map in PDD; 395 = eligible project area

Name: Afforestation Project in Tongliao Inner Mongolia
taxa_notes: From the SMP: "the number of animals has also increased, mainly including wolves, deer pheasants and hares."
methods_notes:
From SMP: "The monitoring team monitored biodiversity in the project area every year, also questionnaires were provided for local stakeholders to collect their comments on the local ecosystem and biodiversity. See the questionnaire for details."
In addition, cameras were installed in the project area to monitor the types and numbers of animals.
data_notes: results in SMP were simple species lists with no abundance information
notes: coordinates based on online map; 1371 = planted area cited in SMP

Name: Australian Yarra Yarra Biodiversity Project
taxa_notes: Informal surveys revealed: "Anecdotal evidence of rare fauna such as black cockatoo and on some properties mallee fowl along with flora"
methods_notes: Relying on incidental reports by "Auscarbon’s Project Manager and external consultants": "Annual inspections but 5 yearly reporting assessment. This timeframe is required to see significant increases (or otherwise) in populations of interest."
notes: coordinates based on online map

Name: Conservation and reforestation of degraded areas in Barbosa Colombia
taxa_notes: No mention of animal monitoring. "Several native species were identified within the natural forests inside the project area."
notes: area is eligible planted area

Name: ArBolivia
taxa_notes: Only vegetation-based biodiversity monitoring (Simpsons index, Leaf Area Index, % cover)
notes: area based area planted (Table 3 of 2021 annual report); annual emmissions reductions based on 164,300 tCO2 / 11 years (from 2021 annual report)

Name: CommuniTree
methods_notes: PDD states they will conduct "Biodiversity and threats to biodiversity surveys"; annual report only has info on number of trees planted and number of tree species
notes: coordinates estimated based on PDF map; area = planted area from 2022 annual report; annual emmissions = 3,327,485 / 13 years (2010-2022) from 2022 annual report

Name: Emiti Nibwo Bulora
taxa_notes: 2 native tree species that are planted are mentioned and tracked; no animal monitoring though benefits for birds, mammals, and insects are noted
methods_notes: no on-the-ground animal monitoring
notes: coordinates are center of Karagwe district; annual emmissions = total of 56993 divided by 8 years

Name: EthioTrees
taxa_notes: 2 native tree species planted as noted in annual report (Moringa & Acacia albida); mammals and birds were asked about in community interviews
methods_notes: mammal and bird populations were asked about in community interviews according to PDD; no results presented in annual report
notes: area is target taken from the PDD; emmissions estimate is total of 167490 tons divided by 8 years

Name: Gula Gula
taxa_notes: Table 20 in PDD:
methods_notes: From PDD: "Currently we are in the process of developing a multi-year plan of biodiversity monitoring with the Biology Department of Andalas University.", Methods noted in PDD: Funnel traps for soil biota; camera traps for mammals; point counts for birds; frequency was actually 4x per year in some cases (e.g., birds); bioaccoustics for birds too (described in annual report 2022; implemented this approach due to covid)
notes: emmissions = total of 65,280 divided by 5 years; area = 1333 + 200 planned ha described in PDD

Name: Halo Verde
taxa_notes: "In 2018, Conservation International conducted a wildlife monitoring training exercise with FCOTI staff in Laclubar, during which they found 21 bird species, 5 reptile species and 2 small rodent species…"; also mention potential plans to monitor frogs and butterflies
methods_notes: "A more comprehensive biodiversity baseline study may be undertaken , subject to availability of financial resources …"; no animal monitoring results presented in 2022 annual report
data_notes: initial CI biodiversity survey results are presented in an unpublished/unavailable report
notes: emmissions = total divided by 13 years; area is estimated reforested area projected in 2029 in the PDF; coords very approximate from PDF map

Name: Hiniduma Bio-Link
taxa_notes: Table 18.1 in PDD lists 2 mammals, 3 birds, and 2 reptiles as indicator species of high, medium, and low habitat disturbance
methods_notes: Incidental baseline data collection described in the PDD in Table 18.1: "Base lines were taken as visual identification in areas." However, no firm animal-based indicators listed in Table 18.2 and no mention of animals (or native plants) in the annual report.
notes: emissions = 2767 total / 9 years (2010-2018); area = 9.7 planted ha

Name: Mikoko Pamoja
taxa_notes:
Planting native mangrove (2 species) that will be tracked; above Table 18 in PDD: " New recruitments of mangroves
and abundance and diversity of fauna such as fish, molluscs and gastropods will be
monitored annually." Also mentions crabs in Table 18. Biodiversity database referenced in validation report: "List of sightings of flora and fauna (bird species, insects included)"
methods_notes:
PDD, section K3: "KMFRI will use its research capacity to train community members on participatory
monitoring and reporting of environmental and biodiversity impacts." Fauna are not reported on in the Annual reports other than notes of forest scouts performing monitoring 3 times per year (Annex 1 in annual reports)
data_notes: "Biodiversity impacts: please see attached document ‘05 Mikoko Pamoja Faunal Survey summary results’"
notes: emissions = 18052 total / 13 years (2010-2022)

Name: Scolel'te
taxa_notes:
PDD states that tree species are monitored, but mammals, birds and reptiles are noted from camera trapping surveys in the 2021 annual report; metrics in table 23 of PDD: "Number of established tree species.
- Number of endangered tree species registered by the IUCN Red List and the NOM-059."
methods_notes: "In the last two years (2018-2019), Scolel’te has organized, trained and equipped a group of community technicians able to collect information about the biodiversity impacts of the program. The information is collected every two and six months, depending on the species to be monitored and reported." Methods unspecified, but camera trapping results are presented in annual report
notes: emissions = 793,361 total / 24 years (1997-2020)

Name: Tahiry Honko
taxa_notes: "biodiversity monitoring"; taxa not specified other than the native mangroves planted
methods_notes: methods not specified; "a baseline biodiversity survey was conducted in February 2018"; "Community monitors have been trained to survey for the indicator species, and regular monitoring will be carried out to determine any impact on the key species"; "Annual surveys will be collated to model 5-year population trends"
data_notes: 2018 monitoring results mentioned but not presented
notes: total emissions reduction was listed as 0 so far

Name: Trees for Global Benefits
taxa_notes: section K3 in PDD and 5.6.1 in annual report only lists tree species-based metrics (% native species planted); also ha conserved
methods_notes: only tree species were monitored, exact methods not provided
notes: emissions = 3,890,163 total / 20 years (2003-2022)

Name: Vanga
taxa_notes: "New recruitments of mangroves and abundance and diversity of fauna such as fish, molluscs and gastropods will be monitored annually."
methods_notes: mangroves monitored in 132 forest plots (PDD, Table 1); mangrove stump counts is main measure; no animal methods or results discussed in all 3 annual reports; in 2022 report: "Additional biodiversity monitoring was not possible this year due to Covid restrictions on travel by students and researchers."; PDD: "Fauna: recorded abundance and species diversity of molluscs and, if possible, crabs."
data_notes: PDD: "Copies of all monitoring data will be kept centrally by the project co-ordinator in Vanga and will be open for anybody to inspect."
notes: emissions = 14023 total / 3 years (2020-2022); area = sum from table 10 in PDD

Name: Bujang Raba
taxa_notes: 8 species of mammals in the camera trap photos in 2021-2022 annual report; hornbills mentioned as tracked
methods_notes: PDD: camera traps & patrols: "...siting or signs of high value species (including tigers, tapir, large primates, bears, hornbills, etc.). Youth and community members active in the forest will also be asked to report on biodiversity…"; Table annex 5c: "Encounter rates of high conservation value species...10km long patrol route, usually lasting at least 3 days every month"
notes: emissions = 303,280 / 10 years (2013-2022); area is forest remaining in 2022

Name: Drawa Rainforest
taxa_notes: unspecified "flora and fauna"
methods_notes: PDD (p 151): "The Land Management Committee will undertake random transact walks through the Protected Area and count sightings of flora and fauna identified within the baseline."; called "ongoing/opportunistic" "presence/absence" surveys in the annual report
data_notes: "Details of the biodiversity monitoring is supplied in Section 8 of the Drawa PD Part B D3.2b v1.0 20151009."; annual report says monitoring results in unavailable report: "Drawa Monitoring Report 2 D3.3 v1.1 16122021"
notes: emissions = total / 9 years (2012-2020); area = eligible area from PDD

Name: Durian Rambun
taxa_notes: PDD states that HCV species are monitored and the number HCV species from each taxonomic group is listed (p. 8)
methods_notes: "Monthly biodiversity monitoring carried out by community forest patrol teams will mark the location and number of encounters with high conservation value (HCV) species and threats to biodiversity (e.g. cleared forest and trees, poaching, fire)."; AR(2018): "2015-2017... patrolled 19 times", reported 7 mammals; camera trap use for tigers stated in PDD, but not reported on in AR(2018); "10km long patrol route, usually lasting at least 3 days every month"
data_notes: non-patrol monitoring (e.g., camera traps) carried out by Flora & Fauna International, which presumably has reports on the results
notes: annual emissions reduction = reported in website text; area = area under mgmt (annual report as of 2018)

Name: Hieu Commune
taxa_notes: monitoring High Conservation Value (HCV) species, mainly 2 primates and 3 species of plants; primates: northern buffed-cheeked gibbon (Nomascus annamensis); grey-shanked douc langur (Pygathrix cinerea)
methods_notes: "Monthly biodiversity monitoring carried out by community forest patrol teams will mark the location and number of encounters with high conservation value (HCV) species and threats to biodiversity (e.g. cleared forest and trees, poaching, fire)."; "Community patrol with technical support of FFI team"
notes: area is total forest area enrolled from PDD; annual emissions reductions = mean of leakage-corrected annual values (years 0-30) from Table 14 (PDD)

Name: Khasi Hills Community REDD+
Proponent: Ka Synjuk Ki Hima Arliang Wah Umiam Mawphlang Welfare Society
taxa_notes: PDD: "The program monitors the siting of key indicator species of birds, mammals, amphibians, and reptiles." But only 'key indicator species', and the monitoring indicator in the K3 table includes only "endangered mammals".
methods_notes: camera trap not mentioned in PDD, but results provided in AR; "The CFs [community facilitators] and youth volunteers record any observations on biodiversity record sheets. Information recorded includes the name of the species observed, time and place, GPS location, evidence of its presence (scat, fur, animal or bird, call, etc.), and the condition of the location. The record is presented and reviewed by the project team at the end of the year." (PDD); Target is >2 surveys per year
notes: area of plantings from PDD; annual emissions reduction from PDD Table G8f.

Name: Loru Forest
taxa_notes: AR (2017-2019): "the presence of invertebrates, birds, bats and plant species has noticeably increased over the seven-year period since the carbon project began"
methods_notes: 8 monitoring plots, formal visual surveys by forest rangers; AR (2017-2019): "Biodiversity surveys as routine part of forest ranger role description...Biodiversity survey by means of animal presence/absence recorded...3-yearly collation of data gathered regularly throughout the monitoring period"; "Biodiversity observations were recorded 4 times during transact walks for forest monitoring and through monitoring 8 plots. The data was collected on the below dates by the following observers"
notes: area is 'crediting area' of coastal rainforest from PDD; emissions from table 5.5 in 2020 annual report

Name: Mikoko Pamoja
taxa_notes: PDD: Native Mangroves planted and monitored; "Three yearly monitoring of fauna especially crabs in protected areas"; in seagrass: "Survey of macrofauna (shellfish, sea cucumbers, fish etc.) – basic survey annually supplemented by detailed survey every 5 years" https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fevo.2019.00062/full
methods_notes: "monitoring of fauna", 3x / yr; methods not specified in PDD; AR specifies that monitoring done by 'forest scouts' that were recruited to monitor for illegal activies like logging or poaching
notes: area is sum of areas from 3 project zones (PDD); emissions is from Part F, Table 3 in PDD

Name: Nanga Lauk
taxa_notes: Table 14 in 2022 annual report lists all animal species encountered during incidental surveys; plant species and a plant inventory are also discussed
methods_notes: PDD: "forest patrol teams will also record signs and sightings of high conservation value species, and threats to biodiversity they encounter during their patrols."
notes: area is PDD sum of two project areas; emissions reductions from Table 9 (PDD)

Name: Punan Long Adiu
taxa_notes: PDD: monitored species will include "will include keystone species (expected to be indicators for a broader range of species), species significant to international conservation efforts, and species of local interest.";
methods_notes: PDD: "forest patrol teams will also record signs and sightings of high conservation value species, and threats to biodiversity they encounter during their patrols." (identical language to Nanga project); "Location of observation, distance from observer, type of observation (seen/heard), sex and reproductive status (if known), confidence in identification...Location, type of sign (spoor/scat/other), confidence in identification...Recorded by patrol teams...Reported to project coordinator every 3 months"
data_notes: on website it says: "Awaiting first annual report"
notes: PDD: "55,216 tonnes of CO2 emission reductions per year are expected"; "The Punan Adiu Customary Community Territory (PACT) covers a total area of 17,415 ha"; note: website says 0 credits issued to date and "Awaiting first annual report"

Name: Rarakau
taxa_notes: PDD: "biodiversity" is monitored, native forests and forest birds are the significant biodiversity cobenefit specified; annual report lists birds and plant species encountered during informal surveys
methods_notes: From annual report: "Bird surveys have involved walking through the forest and forest margins and spotting and listening to birds. Vegetation surveys have involved walking through the forest and forest margins and noting plant species present."; methods not specified in PDD, but state that paid monitoring will take place if carbon credit funding is available, and simplified monitoring otherwise; results and methods likely occur in unavailable report referenced
data_notes: Results of monitoring of biodiversity impacts according to our monitoring plan for the reporting period are provided in Appendix 5 of the Monitoring Report 2 Dc.P1.13 v1.0 2018.
notes: area from website, emissions from Table 2.7.1 (PDD)

Name: Rehabilitation of the Sahel (REACH)
taxa_notes: PDD: Number of tree species present on the rehabilitated pasture sites; Number of herbaceous species present on the rehabilitated pasture sites;
methods_notes: Methods of plant (tree and herbaceous species) inventory unspecified; 2019 annual report states that monitoring did not occur due to security issues
notes: This project and the other Sahel project ("AGED") appear to have identical project information, though this ("REACH") project does not monitor mammals;emmissions reduction: 7250 ha * 49 tCO2e/ha over 30 years

Name: Yaeda-Eyasi Landscape REDD Project
taxa_notes: bird counts at two time points; only medium to large mammals monitored using community member surveyors
methods_notes: annual report 2023: for birds, "Timed Species Counts (TSCs) were completed year on year in two locations inside the project area"; PDD: Smartphones carried by "village game scouts" to log wildlife locations: "Monthly presence/absence of tracks, dung and sightings of Giraffe, Elephant, Zebra, Impala, Lesser Kudu, Eland, Buffalo, Warthog, Leopard, Lion, and Wild dog observed by VGSs, compiled annually"
notes: emmissions reductions: 84,655 tCO2e over 20 years (p. 8 of PDD)

Name: Babatana Rainforest
taxa_notes: PDD: initial rapid assessment focused on "birds, mammals, frogs and reptiles" and Table lists plant species of interest for monitoring as well;
methods_notes:
Website: "The project uses the Nakau methodology…"; PDD: "project biodiversity impacts will be measured by means of opportunistic biodiversity
observations, conducted in parallel with the Boundary and EFA inspection. The approach is semi-quantitative..."; performed by "community rangers"
data_notes: Biodiversity monitoring reporting in Annual Report (2015-2019) in Annex 1 which was "Supplied as a separate document" and was unavailable; PDD: "Details of the biodiversity monitoring are supplied in Section 8.3 of Part B of this PD"
notes: emissions reductions from website: "The project is expected to generate an average of 17,423 tradable carbon credits every year over its duration of 30 years."

Name: Rehabilitation of the Sahel (AGED)
taxa_notes: PDD (section K3): Number of tree, herbaceous plant, and mammal species present on the rehabilitated pasture sites; AR: only plant results presented
methods_notes: PDD: "...biodiversity impacts will be biannually assessed during the household and asset survey together with the local communities."
notes: This project and the other Sahel project ("REACH") appear to have identical project information, though this ("AGED") project also monitors mammals; emmissions reduction: 7250 ha * 49 tCO2e/ha over 30 years

Name: BigCoast Forest Climate Initiative
Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use (improved forest management)
Distinctions: 06: Clean Water and Sanitation; 12: Responsible Consumption and Production; 13: Climate Action; 14: Life Below Water; 15: Life on Land
taxa_notes: mentions benefits to fish and wildlife habitat but no on-the-ground animal or plant monitoring
methods_notes: no mention of on-the-ground animal or plant monitoring; some positive impacts are through donating to conservation orgs

Name: Darkwoods Forest Carbon Project
Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use (improved forest management)
Distinctions: 06: Clean Water and Sanitation; 13: Climate Action; 15: Life on Land
taxa_notes: mentions benefits to grizzly bears but no on-the-ground animal or plant monitoring
methods_notes: only biodiversity metrics are area of forest and area far from roads (to benefit grizzly bears)
notes: PD states that it was also enrolled in CCB but wasn't in our download

Name: Rimba Raya Biodiversity Reserve Project
Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use (avoided deforestation & improved forest management)
Distinctions: 01: No Poverty; 02: Zero Hunger; 03: Good Health and Well-being; 04: Quality Education; 05: Gender Equality; 06: Clean Water and Sanitation; 07: Affordable and Clean Energy; 08: Decent Work and Economic Growth; 09: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure; 10: Reduced Inequalities; 11: Sustainable Cities and Communities; 12: Responsible Consumption and Production; 13: Climate Action; 14: Life Below Water; 15: Life on Land; 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions; 17: Partnerships for the Goals
taxa_notes: only Orangutans are mentioned, so assume they are at least one of the targets of the unspecified "biodiversity monitoring" mentioned; ha of forest is main biodiversity measure; only animal related metric was "number of orangutans released"
methods_notes: MR: "biodiversity monitoring and forest patrols to protect threatened species" but no on-the-ground monitoring of animals or plants is mentioned anywhere in PD, VR, or MR; only forest cover and number of orangutans released
notes: also appears to be under verification by CCB, but was not present in list when CCB projects were downloaded
